alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:09PM EDT until July 09 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lancaster and Lebanon. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lancaster, Columbia, Lititz, Millersville, Willow Street, Manheim, East Petersburg, Cornwall, Akron, Leola, Salunga- Landisville, Rothsville, Mountville, Brickerville, Quentin, Leacock, Lampeter, Penryn, Bird-In-Hand and Smoketown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
